reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a cute friends to lover read
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely LOVED Percy and Sam. The summer lake vibe was everything. I’m a sucker for a friends to lovers trope.Percy’s family purchases a summer lake house in Barry’s Bay. Little did she know, her life would forever change. Right next door are two boys, Charlie and Sam. They live with their widowed mother. They all become instant friends and spend every day together playing in the lake. Sam and Percy have an instant connection. Percy loves horror movies and Sam loves medical books. What more could you ask for in a best friend?The two grow up together those summers eating ice cream, running and swimming across the lake—they can’t imagine life without the other. What happens when your BFF makes you feel all the feels? Do you risk the friendship for something more?It’s when you take a friendship to the next level that life becomes complicated. How will they survive college without one another? Sam has a difficult time adjusting to college and starts calling Percy less and less. Has he changed his mind? When miscommunication and misunderstanding leads to the biggest heartbreak of your life. A giant mistake that leads to a decade apart. Two hearts never mending. What happened?A heartbreaking phone call rushes Percy back to Barry’s Bay. What will it be like to see Sam after all those years? Will all be forgiven? Can they finally tell each other what happened 10 years ago? And if they do, will they be able to handle it and move forward?I couldn’t put this book down. Their story was so captivating and I rooted for them from the first time they saw each other. A perfect summer read with the right amount of spice."You came home.” "Not many pcople meet the person they're meant to be with when they're thirteen. But we did. You know we did. I want you now. And I want you forever.”“It is at this precise moment that he turns around, catching me mid-ass-ogle.”"She told me to call you," he says, serious again. I stop breathing. "Before she died. She said he'd need you after."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars cute summer romance read
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed reading this and it gave me such warm fuzzy feels. The author did an amazing job of switching back and fourth from past to present I loved getting to see the friendship and romance blossom between the two main characters during those summers when they were growing up. You could see and feel the love they had for one another. I had every intention of giving this book 5 stars until the end. I didn’t love some of the choices made by some of the main characters and I felt like there were a couple holes for me in the ending for me but overall I did enjoy this book and would recommend picking it up and giving it a read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars John Candy References!
reviews.reviewText: Persephone is thirty years old and she just got dumped. She didn’t really care, he didn’t mean much to her and she never really let him in, even after seven months. She gets a phone call that has her racing back to her past, the small town of Barry’s Bay, and back into the life of the one who got away… Sam Florek.For six summers Percy and Sam were inseparable. The friendship naturally blossomed and grew into something more and he became the man she never wanted to live without, until it fell apart in a splash.Percy returns for Sam’s mothers funeral and all the feelings come rushing back, their connection burning as brightly as it had twelve years ago. But Percy has a secret, a reason for why she broke up with him, and until she tells him, they can never be together.Told in dual timelines, we unravel the mystery of the once in a lifetime love story between two people who were as fated as a couple could be.First and foremost, there are not one but TWO John Candy references in this book. He is a late Canadian actor who was popular in the 80s. Most will know him as the Polka Player from home alone but I know him from so much more. Trust me, he deserves this paragraph of recognition and I praise the author for including him as he is slowly being forgotten.Now onto the story.I loved it. No ifs ands or buts about it. I absolutely love this story. It is a dual timeline, second chance romance and I think it got me out of my reading slump. I finished it in less than 2 days and couldn’t put it down.The history of the characters, watching them slowly fall in love and come to terms with their feelings. Seeing how they struggle over the long distances and other romances that pop up. It was so well written and it felt like I was watching two people I knew in real life fall for each other. It was so realistic , even the lows had me tearing up but remaining hopeful.The twist, the reason why they broke up, was predictable. I saw it coming not long into the book but it didn’t take away from the heartache I felt when it was revealed.I enjoyed that we also got to explore relationships outside of the main love interest. We got to know Percy’s friends and how they interacted with Sam too which was a nice break from the romance and gave depth outside of the love interest.Great book and I’m so thankful it got recommended to me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good, just a tad bit cheesy
reviews.reviewText: It’s a romance and it’s not a super original one but it was a good read, not smutty or cheesy to a point which would make you cringe. If you liked the summer I turned pretty you’d like this a lot, it was interesting. Def recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for me
reviews.reviewText: Personally, I didn’t like the switching back and forth between now and years past. There were also certain parts that had holes in it. Lastly, I did not like choices made by main characters. It really killed the story for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Loved the way this book made me feel from start to finish
reviews.reviewText: Loved the way this book made me feel from start to finish. Nothing ground-breaking just the joy of long hot summer days spent with your favourite person.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved every second of this one! 5+ stars! Really made me want to rent a cottage at a lake lol.

„A heartbreakingly of love and loss“ ist eine wirklich sehr treffende Beschreibung für dieses Buch.Absolute Leseempfehlung für diejenigen, die gerne Young Adult Bücher lesen. Eine Sommerlektüre, die sicher an einigen Stellen vorhersehbar ist, deswegen jedoch nicht weniger schön zu lesen ist in meinen Augen.
